page.title: 16CHURCH GARDEN FETE
page.content: Rector Edward Boteler, royalist high churchman,in 1650 antagonised his par- ishioners by altering the register en- tries of Quaker births and burials. So was born the strong 'chapel' tradition still with us to-day. The magnificent old church has few supporters but heavy commitments. The annual church garden party is the major event of the village.Church supporters man the att- ractions,all the village rallies round and funds are raised. Cake, white elephant, tombola and plant stalls vie with games of skittles and clock golf, while a fortune teller reassures every one of the future. A local band plays for those who have spent up while waiting for the Grand Draw to be dec- ided.There are compeititoins for child ren and general approval of the after- noon's success while deciding that we really must do better next year.
